attributes.action: make tuition fees apply to all graduates retrospectively, not just to those who have recently gone to University
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The hypocrisy of tuition fee hikes must stop. Those that are arguing for larger fees and that are in power paid no fees themselves, and even received grants. Until their fees have been reclaimed there should be no increase in fees for current students.

The reasoning is obvious. It will help out the goverment debt crisis. It will stop the hypocrisy of a generation who received free education increasing fees. It will help out people under 25 in a time of high youth unemployment.

Interest should be retrospectively applied under the same rules as the current student loans.

Practically this could work through the student loan scheme, with the same rules applying. No amount will be paid until the worker is earning over £15,000, and then 9% above that threshold.

It would also apply to students who paid less than the current rate. Their loans would be 'topped up'. As well as the payment of fees, the repayment of grants would also happen under this scheme.
